subject: Politics
title: What Causes Revolutions
description: Learn What Causes Revolutions in one minute.

hook.text: Revolutions don't start when things are worst. They start when things get better â€” then suddenly stop improving.

buildup.text: Tocqueville noticed that the French Revolution came after decades of progress. Rising expectations met a wall.

discovery.text: The 'J-curve theory' says revolutions erupt when improvement reverses. Dashed hopes are more explosive than misery.

twist.text: North Korea is poorer than France was in 1789. But its people don't revolt â€” because they've never tasted better.

climax.text: Revolution needs more than anger. It needs organization, opportunity, and a trigger that breaks the old order.

punchline.text: Revolutions come from dashed expectations, not just suffering.

quiz.question: According to the J-curve theory, when do revolutions most often erupt?
options: When a period of improvement is suddenly reversed
When a country reaches its lowest point of poverty
